arabicText: سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَسْرَىٰ بِعَبْدِهِۦ لَيْلًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ إِلَى ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْأَقْصَا ٱلَّذِى بَـٰرَكْنَا حَوْلَهُۥ لِنُرِيَهُۥ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَآ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْبَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
Purity	is	to	Him	Who	took	His	bondman	in	
a	part	of	the	night	 from	the	Sacred	Masjid
to	the	Aqsa	Masjid around	which	We	have	
placed	 blessings,	 in	 order	 that	 We	 may	
show	him	Our	great	signs;	indeed	he	is	the	
listener,	 the	beholder.	(This	verse	refers	 to	
the	physical	journey	of	Prophet	Muhammad
– peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him	- to	 Al	
Aqsa	Masjid and	from	 there	 to	 the	heavens	
and	 beyond.	 The	 entire	 journey	 back	 to	
Mecca	was	completed	within	a	small	part	of	
the	night.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Pāki	hai	Usey	jo	rātoñ	rāt apne	bande	ko	le	
gayā	 Masjid-e-Harām (Khāna-e-Kāba) se	
Masjid-e-Aqsā	 (Bait-ul-Muqaddas) tak	 jis	
ke	girda	gird	Ham	ne	Barkat	rakhi	ki Ham	
usey	Apni	aẓeem	nishāniyāñ	dikhāyeñ	Beshak		woh	sunta	dekhta	ha

arabicText: وَءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ هُدًۭى لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَلَّا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ مِن دُونِى وَكِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	gave	Moosa	the	Book,	and	made	it	
a	 guidance	 for	 the	 Descendants	 of	 Israel	
that,	“Do	not	appoint	anyone	as	a	Trustee	
besides	Me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	Mūsā ko	Kitāb	'ata	farmāi	aur	
usey	 bani	 isrāel	 ke	 liye	 hidāyat	 kiya	 ke	
mere	 siwa	 kisi	 ko	 kārsāz	 (kām	 banāne	
wāla)	na	thahrāo

arabicText: ذُرِّيَّةَ مَنْ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ نُوحٍ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَبْدًۭا شَكُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	 descendants	 of	 those	 whom	 We	
boarded	along	with	Nooh;	he	was	indeed	
a	grateful	bondman.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	un	ki	awlād	jinko	ham	ne	Nūh ke	sāth	
sawār	kiya	be-shak		woh	bada	shukr	guzār	
banda	tha

arabicText: وَقَضَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَتُفْسِدُنَّ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مَرَّتَيْنِ وَلَتَعْلُنَّ عُلُوًّۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. And	 We	 decreed	 for	 the	 Descendants	 of	
Israel	 in	 the	 Book	 that,	 “You	 will	 indeed	
create	 great	 turmoil	 in	 the	 earth	 twice,	
and	you	will	surely	become	very	proud.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	bani	Isrāel	ko	Kitāb	meiñ	waḥi	
bheji	 ke	 zaroor	 tum	 zameen	 meiñ	 do	 bār	
fasād	 machāoge	 aur	 zaroor	 bada	 guroor	
karoge.

arabicText: فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ أُولَىٰهُمَا بَعَثْنَا عَلَيْكُمْ عِبَادًۭا لَّنَآ أُو۟لِى بَأْسٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ فَجَاسُوا۟ خِلَـٰلَ ٱلدِّيَارِ ۚ وَكَانَ وَعْدًۭا مَّفْعُولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	when	the	first	of	those	promises	came,	We	sent	upon	you	Our	extremely	militant	bondmen	-
they	therefore	entered	the	cities	pursuing	you;	and	this	was	a	promise	that	had	to	be	fulfilled.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	un	meiñ	pehli	bār	ka	w’ada		āaya	ham	ne	tum	par	apne	kuchh	bande	bheje	sakht	ladhāi	
wāle	to	woh	shaharoñ	ke	andar	tumhāri	talāsh	ko	ghuse	aur	yeh	ek	w’ada		tha	jise	pura	hona

arabicText: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَا لَكُمُ ٱلْكَرَّةَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَأَمْدَدْنَـٰكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍۢ وَبَنِينَ وَجَعَلْنَـٰكُمْ أَكْثَرَ نَفِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
We	 then	reversed	your	attack	upon	 them,	and	aided	you	with	wealth	and	sons	and	increased	
your	numbers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Phir	ham	ne	un	par	ulat	kar	tumhāra	hamla	kar	diya	aur	tum	ko	māloñ	or	betoñ	se	madad	di	aur	
tumhāra	jat-tha	badha	diya	.

arabicText: إِنْ أَحْسَنتُمْ أَحْسَنتُمْ لِأَنفُسِكُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ أَسَأْتُمْ فَلَهَا ۚ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لِيَسُـۥٓـُٔوا۟ وُجُوهَكُمْ وَلِيَدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْمَسْجِدَ كَمَا دَخَلُوهُ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۢ وَلِيُتَبِّرُوا۟ مَا عَلَوْا۟ تَتْبِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
If	 you	 do	good	 deeds,	 you	will	 for	 your	 own	good	- and	if	 you	 commit	evil,	it	is	 for	 yourself;	
therefore	when	the	second	of	those	promises	came	- so	the	enemy	maim	your	faces,	and	enter	
the	 masjid as	 they	 had	 entered	 it	 the	 first	 time,	 and	 destroy	 until	 they	 ruin	 all	 they	 could	
capture.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Agar	tum	bhalāi	karo	ge	apna	bhala	karoge	aur	bura	karoge	to	apna	phir	jab	doosri		bār	ka	w’ada		
āaya	ke	dushman	tumhāra	muñh	bigād	deñ	aur	masjid	meiñ	dākhil	hoñ	jaise	pahli	bār	dākhil	huye	
the	aur	jis	chiz	par	qābu	pāeñ	tabāh	kar	ke	barbād	kar	deñ.

arabicText: عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يَرْحَمَكُمْ ۚ وَإِنْ عُدتُّمْ عُدْنَا ۘ وَجَعَلْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ حَصِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
It	is	likely	that	your	Lord	may	have	mercy	
on	you;	and	if	you	repeat	the	mischief,	We	
will	repeat	 the	punishment;	and	We	have	
made	hell	a	prison	for	the	disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Qareeb	hai	ke	tumhāra	Rab	tum	par	raḥem		
kare	 aur	 agar	 tum	 phir	 sharārat	 karo	 to	
ham phir	 ‘aƶāb	 kareñge	 aur	 ham	 ne	
Jahannam	ko	kāfiroñ ka	qaid	khāna	banāya	
hai

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ يَهْدِى لِلَّتِى هِىَ أَقْوَمُ وَيُبَشِّرُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 this	 Qur’an	 guides	 to	 the	 most	
Straight	Path,	and	gives	glad	tidings	to	the	
believers	 who	 do	 good	 deeds,	 that	 for	
them	is	a	great	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Be-shak	yeh	qurān	woh	rāh	dikhāta	hai	jo	
sab	se	sidhi	hai	aur	khushi	sunāta	hai	Imān
wāloñ	ko	jo achche	kām	kareñ	ke	unke	liye	
badā	ṣawāb	hai

arabicText: وَأَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 those	 who	 do	 not	 believe	 in	 the	
Hereafter	 - We	 have	 kept	 prepared	 for	
them	a	punishment,	most	painful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yeh	ke	jo	ākhirat	par	Imān nahiñ	lāte	
ham	ne	un	ke	liye	dardnāk	‘aƶāb	tayyār	kar	
rakha	hai

arabicText: وَيَدْعُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ بِٱلشَّرِّ دُعَآءَهُۥ بِٱلْخَيْرِ ۖ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ عَجُولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 man	 prays	 for	 evil	 like	 the	 way	 he	
seeks	goodness;	and	man	is	very	hasty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 ādmi	 burāi	 ki	 du’a	 karta	 hai	 jaise	
bhalāi	māñgta	hai	aur	ādmi	bada	jald	bāz	
hai

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ ءَايَتَيْنِ ۖ فَمَحَوْنَآ ءَايَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَجَعَلْنَآ ءَايَةَ ٱلنَّهَارِ مُبْصِرَةًۭ لِّتَبْتَغُوا۟ فَضْلًۭا مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَلِتَعْلَمُوا۟ عَدَدَ ٱلسِّنِينَ وَٱلْحِسَابَ ۚ وَكُلَّ شَىْءٍۢ فَصَّلْنَـٰهُ تَفْصِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	created	 the	night	and	 the	day	as	
two	signs	- We	 therefore	kept	 the	sign	of	
the	 night	 indistinct,	 and	 the	 sign	 of	 the	
day	 visible	 - so	 that	 you	 may	 seek	 the	
munificence	 of	 your	 Lord,	 and	 know	 the	
calculation	 of	 the	 years,	 and	 the	
accounting;	 and	 We	 have	 explained	 all	
things	in	detail,	distinctively.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	 rāt	aur	din	ko	do	nishāniyāñ	
banāya	 to	 rāt	 ki	 nishāni	 miti	 huwi	 rakhi	
aur	din	ki	nishāni	dikhāne	wāli	ki	ke	apne	
Rab	ka	fazl	talāsh	karo	aur	barsoñ	ki	ginti	
aur		hisāb	jāno	aur	ham	ne	har	chiz	khoob	
juda	juda	ẓāhir	farma	di.

arabicText: وَكُلَّ إِنسَـٰنٍ أَلْزَمْنَـٰهُ طَـٰٓئِرَهُۥ فِى عُنُقِهِۦ ۖ وَنُخْرِجُ لَهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ كِتَـٰبًۭا يَلْقَىٰهُ مَنشُورًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 have	 attached	 the	 destiny	 of	
every	man	to	his	neck;	and	We	shall	bring	
forth	 a	 register	 for	 him	 on	 the	 Day	 of	
Resurrection,	which	he	will	find	open.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	har	insān	ki	qismat	ham	ne	us	ke	gale	
se	laga	di	hai	aur	us	ke	liye	qayāmat	ke	din	
ek	nawishta	(tehreer)	nikāleñge	jise	khula	
huwa	pāyega.

arabicText: ٱقْرَأْ كِتَـٰبَكَ كَفَىٰ بِنَفْسِكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكَ حَسِيبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
It	will	be	said,	“Read	your	ledger;	this	day	
you	 are	 sufficient	 to	 take	 your	 own	
account.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāya	 jāyega	 ke	 apna	 nāmā	 (a'āmāl)	
padh	 āaj	 tu	 khud	 hi	 apna	 hisāb	 karne	 ko	
bahut	hai

arabicText: مَّنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّمَا يَضِلُّ عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌۭ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۗ وَمَا كُنَّا مُعَذِّبِينَ حَتَّىٰ نَبْعَثَ رَسُولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	came	to	guidance,	has	come	for	his	own	good;	and	whoever	went	astray,	has	strayed	
for	his	own	ruin;	and	no	burdened	soul	will	bear	another’s	burden;	and	We	never	punish	until	
We	have	sent	a	Noble	Messenger.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Jo	rāh	par	āaya	woh	apne	hi	bhale	ko	rāh	par	āaya	aur	jo	bahka	to	apne	hi	bure	ko	bahka	aur	koi	
bojh	uthāne	wāli	jān	doosre	ka	bojh	na	uthāe	gi	aur	ham	‘aƶāb	karne	wāle	nahiñ	jab	tak	Rasool
na	bhej	leñ

arabicText: وَإِذَآ أَرَدْنَآ أَن نُّهْلِكَ قَرْيَةً أَمَرْنَا مُتْرَفِيهَا فَفَسَقُوا۟ فِيهَا فَحَقَّ عَلَيْهَا ٱلْقَوْلُ فَدَمَّرْنَـٰهَا تَدْمِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 We	 will	 to	 destroy	 a	 township	 We send	 the	 commands	 to	 its	 prosperous	 people,	
thereupon	 they	do	not	obey	 them,	and	so	 the	Word	is	proved	upon	it	- We	 therefore	destroy	
and	ruin	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	ham	kisi	basti	ko	halāk	karna	chāhte	haiñ	us	ke	khush	hāloñ	(ameeroñ)	par	ahkām	bhejte	
haiñ	phir	woh	us	meiñ	be	hukmi	karte	haiñ	to	us	par	bāt	poori	ho	jāti	hai	to	ham	use	tabāh	kar	ke	
barbād	kar	dete	haiñ	.

arabicText: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ نُوحٍۢ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِۦ خَبِيرًۢا بَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	many	a	generation	We	did	destroy	after	Nooh!	And	Allah is	Sufficient,	Aware	of	the	sins	of	
His	bondmen,	the	Beholder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	kitni	hi	sangateñ	(qoumeñ)	Nooh	ke	b'ad	halāk	kar	diñ	aur	tumhāra	Rab	kāfi	hai	apne	
bandoñ	ke	gunāhoñ	se	khabar-dār	dekhne	wāla

arabicText: مَّن كَانَ يُرِيدُ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ عَجَّلْنَا لَهُۥ فِيهَا مَا نَشَآءُ لِمَن نُّرِيدُ ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا لَهُۥ جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَىٰهَا مَذْمُومًۭا مَّدْحُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	 desires	 this	 fleeting	 one,	 We	
may	give	him	quickly	- whatever	We	will,	
to	 whomever	 We	 will;	 and	 then	 assign	
hell	 for	 him;	 for	 him	 to	 enter	 it	
condemned,	pushed	around.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	 yeh	 jaldi	 wāli	 chāhe	Ham	 use	 us	meiñ	
jald	de	deñ	jo	chāheñ	jise	chāheñ	phir	us	ke	
liye	 Jahannam	 kar	 deñ	 ke	 us	 meiñ	 jāye	
mazammat	kiya	huwa	dhhakke	khāta

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَرَادَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ وَسَعَىٰ لَهَا سَعْيَهَا وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌۭ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ كَانَ سَعْيُهُم مَّشْكُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 whoever	 desires	 the	 Hereafter	 and	
strives	for	it	accordingly,	and	is	a	believer	
- so	only	their	effort	has	borne	fruit.
romanUrduTranslationText:
aur	jo	āakhirat	chāhe	aur	uski	si	koshish	
kare	aur	ho	Imān wāla	to	unhiñ	ki	koshish	
thikāne	lagi	Ham	sab	ko	madad	dete	haiñ	.

arabicText: كُلًّۭا نُّمِدُّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ وَهَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مِنْ عَطَآءِ رَبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ عَطَآءُ رَبِّكَ مَحْظُورًا
englishTranslationText:
We	 provide	 help	 to	 all	 - to	 these	 and	 to	
those,	 by	 the	 bestowal	 of	 your	 Lord;	 and	
there	is	 no	 constraint	 on	 the	 bestowal	 of	
your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
un	ko	bhi	aur	un	ko	bhi	tumhāre	Rab	ki	‘ata	
se	aur	tumhāre	Rab	ki	‘ata	par	rok	nahiñ

arabicText: ٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ فَضَّلْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ ۚ وَلَلْـَٔاخِرَةُ أَكْبَرُ دَرَجَـٰتٍۢ وَأَكْبَرُ تَفْضِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Observe	 how	 We	 have	 given	 superiority	
to	 some	 over	 others;	 and	 indeed	 the	
Hereafter	 is	 the	 greatest	 in	 rank	 and	 the	
highest	in	excellence.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Dekho	ham	ne	un	meiñ	ek	ko	ek	par	kaisi	
badāi	 di	aur	 be	 shak	āakhirat	 darjo	meiñ	
sab	se	badi	aur	fazl	meiñ	sab	se	a'ala.

arabicText: لَّا تَجْعَلْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَقْعُدَ مَذْمُومًۭا مَّخْذُولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
O	listener,	do	not	set	up	another	God	with	
Allah,	 for	 you	 will	 then	 remain	 seated	
condemned,	helpless
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 sunne	 wāle!	 Allah	 	 ke	 sath	 doosra	
khuda	 na	 thahra	 ke	 tu	 	 baith	 rahe	 ga	
mazammat	kiya	jāta	bekas

arabicText: ۞ وَقَضَىٰ رَبُّكَ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِيَّاهُ وَبِٱلْوَٰلِدَيْنِ إِحْسَـٰنًا ۚ إِمَّا يَبْلُغَنَّ عِندَكَ ٱلْكِبَرَ أَحَدُهُمَآ أَوْ كِلَاهُمَا فَلَا تَقُل لَّهُمَآ أُفٍّۢ وَلَا تَنْهَرْهُمَا وَقُل لَّهُمَا قَوْلًۭا كَرِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 your	 Lord	 has	 ordained	 that	 you	 do	
not	worship	anyone	except	Him,	and	treat	
your	 parents	 with	 kindness;	 if	 either	 of	
them	 or	 both	 reach	 old	 age	 in	 your	
presence,	do	not	say	“Uff”*	to	them	and	do	
not	 rebuff	 them,	 and	 speak	 to	 them	 with	
the	 utmost	 respect.	 (*	 Any	 expression	 of	
disgust.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tumhāre	 Rab	 ne	ḥukmfarmāya	 ke	 us	
ke	 siwa	 kisi	 ko	 na	 poojo	aur	māñ	 bāp	 ke	
sāth	achha	sulook	Karo	agar	tere	sāmne	un	
meiñ	 ek	 ya	 donoñ	 budhāpe	 ko	 puhuñch	
jāyeñ	to	un	se	hooñ	(uff	tak)	na	kahna	aur	
unheñ	na	jhidakna	aur	un	se	t'āzeem	ki	bāt	
Kahna

arabicText: وَٱخْفِضْ لَهُمَا جَنَاحَ ٱلذُّلِّ مِنَ ٱلرَّحْمَةِ وَقُل رَّبِّ ٱرْحَمْهُمَا كَمَا رَبَّيَانِى صَغِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	lower	your	wing	humbly	 for	them,	with	mercy,	and	pray,	“My	Lord!	Have	mercy	on	them	
both,	the	way	they	nursed	me	when	I	was	young.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	liye	'ājizi	ka	bāzu	bicha	naram	dili	se	aur	‘arz	kar	ke	aey	mere	Rab" Tu	un	donoñ	par	
raḥem	kar	jaisa	ke	un	donoñ	ne	mujhe	chhatpan	(chhoti	umar)	meiñ	pāla

arabicText: رَّبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا فِى نُفُوسِكُمْ ۚ إِن تَكُونُوا۟ صَـٰلِحِينَ فَإِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِلْأَوَّٰبِينَ غَفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Your	 Lord	is	Well	 Aware	 of	 what	is	in	 your	 hearts;	if	 you	 are	 worthy,	 then	indeed	 He is	 Oft	
Forgiving	for	those	who	repent.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Tumhāra	Rab	khoob	jānta	hai	jo	tumhāre	diloñ	meiñ	hai	agar	tum	lāyeq	huwe	to	be	shak	woh	
tauba	karne	waloñ	ko	bakhsh	ne	wāla	hai.

arabicText: وَءَاتِ ذَا ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ حَقَّهُۥ وَٱلْمِسْكِينَ وَٱبْنَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَلَا تُبَذِّرْ تَبْذِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 give	 the	 relatives	 their	 rights,	 and	 to	 the	 needy,	 and	 to	 the	 traveller;	 and	 do	 not	 waste	
needlessly.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rishte	dāroñ	ko	unka	haq	de	aur	miskeen	aur	musafir	ko	aur	fazool	na	uda

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُبَذِّرِينَ كَانُوٓا۟ إِخْوَٰنَ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينِ ۖ وَكَانَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ لِرَبِّهِۦ كَفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	who	needlessly	waste	are	brothers	of	the	devils;	and	the	devil	is	very	ungrateful	to	
his	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be	shak	udāne	wāle	(fizool	kharchi	karne	wāle)	shaitānoñ	ke	bhāi	haiñ	aur	shaiṭān	apne	Rab	ka	
badā	nā	shukra	hai.

arabicText: وَإِمَّا تُعْرِضَنَّ عَنْهُمُ ٱبْتِغَآءَ رَحْمَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّكَ تَرْجُوهَا فَقُل لَّهُمْ قَوْلًۭا مَّيْسُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 if	 you	 turn	 away	 from	 these	 *,	
expecting	 the	 mercy	 of	 your	 Lord,	 for	
which	 you	 hope,	 then	 speak	 to	 them	 an	
easy	word.	(*	The	companions	of	 the	Holy	
Prophet,	who	sought	his	assistance.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tu	un	se	muñh	phere	apne	Rab	ki	
Raḥmat	ke	inteẓār	meiñ	jis	ki	tujhe	ummid	
hai	to	un	se	āasān	bāt	kahe.

arabicText: وَلَا تَجْعَلْ يَدَكَ مَغْلُولَةً إِلَىٰ عُنُقِكَ وَلَا تَبْسُطْهَا كُلَّ ٱلْبَسْطِ فَتَقْعُدَ مَلُومًۭا مَّحْسُورًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 keep	 your	 hand	 tied	 to	 your	
neck	 nor	 open	 it	 completely,	 lest	 you	
remain	seated	- reproached,	weary.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 apna	 hāth	 apni	 gardan	 se	 bandhā	
huwa	na	rakh	aur	na	poora	khol	de	ke	 tu	
baith	rahe	malāmat	kiya	huwa	thakā	huwa

arabicText: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِعِبَادِهِۦ خَبِيرًۢا بَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	your	Lord	eases	the	livelihood	and	
restricts	 it,	 for	 whomever	 He	 wills;	 He	
Well	Knows,	Beholds	His	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Be-shak	 tumhāra Rab	 jise	 chahe	 rizq
kushādah	 deta	 aur	 kasta	 hai	 (tangi	 deta	
hai)	 be-shak	woh	apne	 bandoñ	 ko	 khoob	
jānta	dekhta	hai

arabicText: وَلَا تَقْتُلُوٓا۟ أَوْلَـٰدَكُمْ خَشْيَةَ إِمْلَـٰقٍۢ ۖ نَّحْنُ نَرْزُقُهُمْ وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ قَتْلَهُمْ كَانَ خِطْـًۭٔا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 kill	 your	 children,	 fearing	
poverty;	 We	 shall	 provide	 sustenance	 to	
them	 as	 well	 as	 to	 you;	 indeed	 killing	
them	is	a	great	mistake.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apni	awlād	ko	qatl	na	karo	muflisi	ke	
dar	se	ham	tumheñ	bhi	aur	unheñ	bhi	rozi	
deñ	ge	be	shak	un	ka	qatl	badi	khatā	hai

arabicText: وَلَا تَقْرَبُوا۟ ٱلزِّنَىٰٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فَـٰحِشَةًۭ وَسَآءَ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 approach	 adultery	 - it	 is	
indeed	 a	 shameful	 deed;	 and	 a	 very	 evil	
way.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	badkāri	ke	pās	na	jāo	be	shak	woh	be	
hayāi	hai	or	bahut	hi	buri	rāh

arabicText: وَلَا تَقْتُلُوا۟ ٱلنَّفْسَ ٱلَّتِى حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَمَن قُتِلَ مَظْلُومًۭا فَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا لِوَلِيِّهِۦ سُلْطَـٰنًۭا فَلَا يُسْرِف فِّى ٱلْقَتْلِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مَنصُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 wrongfully	 kill	 any	 living	
being	which	Allah has	 forbidden;	and	 for	
whoever	 is	 slain	 wrongfully,	 We	 have	
given	 the	 authority	 to	 his	 heir,	 so	 he	
should	not	cross	limits	in	slaying;	he	will	
surely	be	helped
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	koi	jān	jis	ki	hurmat	Allah	ne	rakhi	hai	
na	haq	na	māro	aur	jo	na	haq	māra	jāye	to	
be	shak	ham	ne	us	ke	wāriṣ ko	qābu	diya	
hai	 to	 woh	 qatl	 meiñ	 had	 se	 na	 badhe	
zaroor	us	ki	madad	honi	hai.

arabicText: وَلَا تَقْرَبُوا۟ مَالَ ٱلْيَتِيمِ إِلَّا بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ حَتَّىٰ يَبْلُغَ أَشُدَّهُۥ ۚ وَأَوْفُوا۟ بِٱلْعَهْدِ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلْعَهْدَ كَانَ مَسْـُٔولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 approach	 the	 wealth	 of	 the	
orphan	 except	 in	 the	 best	 possible	 way,	
till	 he	 reaches	 adulthood;	 and	 fulfil	 the	
promise;	 indeed	 the	 promise	 will	 be	
asked	about.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yateem	ke	māl	ke	pās	na	jāo	magar	us	
rāh	se	jo	sab	se	bhali	hai	yahāñ	tak	ke	woh	
apni	jawāni	ko	pahuñche		aur	'ahad	pura	
karo	be	shak	'ahad	se	sawāl	hona	hai

arabicText: وَأَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ إِذَا كِلْتُمْ وَزِنُوا۟ بِٱلْقِسْطَاسِ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌۭ وَأَحْسَنُ تَأْوِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	correctly	measure	when	you	measure,	and	weigh	correctly	with	 the	scales;	 this	is	better,	
and	has	a	better	outcome.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	māpo	to	pura	māpo	aur	barabar	tarāzu	se	tolo	yeh	behtar	hai	aur	is	ka	anjām	achha

arabicText: وَلَا تَقْفُ مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْبَصَرَ وَٱلْفُؤَادَ كُلُّ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ كَانَ عَنْهُ مَسْـُٔولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	pursue	the	matter	you	do	not	have	the	knowledge	of;	indeed	the	ear,	and	the	eye,	
and	the	heart	- each	of	these	will	be	questioned.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	bāt	ke	pichhe	na	pad	jis	ka	tujhe	'ilm	nahiñ	be	shak	kān	aur	āankh	aur	dil	un	sab	se	sawāl	
hona	hai

arabicText: وَلَا تَمْشِ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّكَ لَن تَخْرِقَ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَلَن تَبْلُغَ ٱلْجِبَالَ طُولًۭا
englishTranslationText: And	do	not	walk	haughtily	on	the	earth;	you	can	never	split	the	earth,	nor	be	as	high	as	the	hill
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	meiñ	itrāta	na	chal	be	shak	tu	hargiz	zameen	na	cheer	dale	ga	aur	hargiz	bulandi	
meiñ	pahādoñ	ko	na	pahuñche	ga

arabicText: كُلُّ ذَٰلِكَ كَانَ سَيِّئُهُۥ عِندَ رَبِّكَ مَكْرُوهًۭا
englishTranslationText: Of	all	this	related	before,	the	evil	among	it	is	disliked	by	your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: .Yeh	jo	kuchh	guzra	un	meiñ	ki	buri	bāt	tere	Rab	ko	nāpasand	hai

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ مِمَّآ أَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ رَبُّكَ مِنَ ٱلْحِكْمَةِ ۗ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتُلْقَىٰ فِى جَهَنَّمَ مَلُومًۭا مَّدْحُورًا
englishTranslationText:
This	 is	 part	 of	 the	 divine	 revelations	 of	
wisdom	 that	 your	Lord	has	sent	down	 to	
you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him);	and	O	listener,	
do	not	set	up	another	God	with	Allah,	 for	
you	 will	 then	 be	 thrown	 into	 hell	 -
rebuked,	rebuffed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	 un	Waḥiyoñ	 meiñ	 se	 hai	 jo	 tumhāre	
Rab	ne	tumhāri	ṭaraf	bheji	hikmat	ki	bāteñ	
aur	 Aur	 aey	 sunne	 wāle" Allah	 ke	 sāth	
doosra	 khuda	 na	 thahra	 	 ke	 tu	jahannam		
meiñ	 pheñkā	 jāyega	 	 ṭ'anā	 pāta	 dhakke	
khāta.

arabicText: أَفَأَصْفَىٰكُمْ رَبُّكُم بِٱلْبَنِينَ وَٱتَّخَذَ مِنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنَـٰثًا ۚ إِنَّكُمْ لَتَقُولُونَ قَوْلًا عَظِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Has	 your	 Lord	 chosen	 sons	 for	 you,	 and	
created	 daughters	 for	 Himself	 from	
among	 the	 angels?	 Indeed	 you	 utter	 a	
profound	word!
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Kya	tumhāre	Rab	ne	tum	ko	bete	chun	diye	
aur	apne	liye	farishtoñ	se	betiyāñ	banāiñ?	
be	shak	tum	badā	bol	bolte	ho.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا فِى هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا۟ وَمَا يَزِيدُهُمْ إِلَّا نُفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	 have	 explained	 in	 this	 Qur’an	 in	
various	 ways,	 for	 them	 to	 understand;	
and	 it	 increases	 nothing	 except	 their	
hatred	towards	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be	 shak	 ham	 ne	 is	 Qurān	 me	 tarah	
tarah	 se	 bayān	 farmāya	 ke	 woh	 samjheñ	
aur	is	se	unheñ	nahiñ	badhti	magar	nafrat

arabicText: قُل لَّوْ كَانَ مَعَهُۥٓ ءَالِهَةٌۭ كَمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذًۭا لَّٱبْتَغَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ ذِى ٱلْعَرْشِ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad -
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“If	there	
were	 other	 Gods	 besides	 Him”	 - as	 they	
utter	 - “then	 they	 would	 have	 certainly	
found	 a	 way	 towards	 *	 the	 Owner	 of	 the	
Throne!”.	(*	To	fight	against	Him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Tum	 farmāo	 agar	 us	 ke	 sāth	 aur	 khuda	
hote	jaisa	yeh	bakte	haiñ	jab	to	woh	'arsh	
ke	mālik	ki	ṭaraf	koi	rāh	dhuñdh	nikālte	.

arabicText: سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ وَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يَقُولُونَ عُلُوًّۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Purity	 and Supremacy	 are	 to	 Him	 from	
what	they	utter,	a	Great	Supremacy!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Usey	 pāki	 or	 bartari	 un	 ki	 bātoñ	 se	 badi	
bartari

arabicText: تُسَبِّحُ لَهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ ٱلسَّبْعُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَن فِيهِنَّ ۚ وَإِن مِّن شَىْءٍ إِلَّا يُسَبِّحُ بِحَمْدِهِۦ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تَفْقَهُونَ تَسْبِيحَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ حَلِيمًا غَفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	seven	heavens	and	the	earth	and	all	those	
in	them	say	His	Purity;	and	there	is	not	a	thing	
that	does	not	proclaim	His	purity	with	praise,	
but	you	do	not	understand	their	proclamation	
of	 purity;	 indeed	 He	 is	 Most	 Forbearing,	 Oft	
Forgiving.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	 ki	 pāki	 bolte	 haiñ	 sātoñ	 āasmān	 aur	
zameen	aur	jo	koi	un	meiñ	hain	aur	koi	chiz	
nahiñ	jo	use	sarāhti	(tāreef	karti)	huwi	us	
ki	pāki	na	bole	hāñ	tum	un	ki	tasbeeh	nahiñ	
samajhte	be	shak	woh	hilm	wāla	bakhsh	ne	
wāla	hai.

arabicText: وَإِذَا قَرَأْتَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ جَعَلْنَا بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ حِجَابًۭا مَّسْتُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	you	read	the	Qur’an	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	upon	him),	We	
created	an	invisible	barrier	between	you	and	those	who	do	not	believe	in	the	Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 aey	 Mehboob" Tum	 ne	 qurān	 padha	
ham	ne	tum	par	aur	un	meiñ	ke		ākhirat	par	
Imān nahiñ	lāte	ek	chupa	huwa	pardah	kar	
diya

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًۭا ۚ وَإِذَا ذَكَرْتَ رَبَّكَ فِى ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَحْدَهُۥ وَلَّوْا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَدْبَـٰرِهِمْ نُفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	placed	covers	upon their	hearts	so	they	may	not	understand	it,	and	deafness	in	their	ears;	
and	when	you	mention	your	Only	Lord	in	the	Qur’an,	they	flee	turning	their	backs	in	hatred.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	un ke	diloñ	par	ghilāf	dāl	diye	
haiñ	ke	isey	na	samjheñ	aur	un	ke	kānoñ	meiñ	tent	(rui)	aur	jab	tun	Qurān	meiñ	apne	akele	Rab	
ki	yād	karte	ho	woh	pith	pher	kar	bhāgte	haiñ	nafrat	karte	.

arabicText: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَسْتَمِعُونَ بِهِۦٓ إِذْ يَسْتَمِعُونَ إِلَيْكَ وَإِذْ هُمْ نَجْوَىٰٓ إِذْ يَقُولُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ إِن تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلًۭا مَّسْحُورًا
englishTranslationText:
We	 know	 well	 why	 they	 listen	 when	 they	 lend	 ears	 to	 you,	 and	 when	 they	 discuss	 among	
themselves,	when	the	unjust	say,	“You	have	not	followed	except	a	man	who	is	under	a	magic	spell.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
ham	khoob	jānte	haiñ	jis	liye	woh	sunte	haiñ	jab	tumhāri	ṭaraf	kān	lagāte	haiñ	aur	jab	āpas	meiñ	
mashwarah	karte	haiñ	jabke	ẓālim	kahte	haiñ	tum	pichhe	nahiñ	chale	magar	ek	aise	mard	ke	jis	
par	jādu	huwa

arabicText: ٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا۟ لَكَ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا۟ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText: See	the	kind	of	examples	they	invent	for	you!	They	therefore	strayed,	so	cannot	find	a	path.
romanUrduTranslationText: Dekho	unhoñ	ne	tumheñ	kaisi	tasbeeheñ	diñ	to	gumrāh	huwe	ke	rāh	nahiñ	pā	sakte

arabicText: وَقَالُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَـٰمًۭا وَرُفَـٰتًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ خَلْقًۭا جَدِيدًۭا
englishTranslationText: And	they	say,	“When	we	have	become	bones	and	decomposed,	will	we	really	be	raised	up	anew?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bole	kya	jab	ham	haddiyañ	aur	reza	reza	ho	jāyeñ	ge	kya	sach	much	naye	ban	kar	utheñ	ge.

arabicText: ۞ قُلْ كُونُوا۟ حِجَارَةً أَوْ حَدِيدًا
englishTranslationText: Proclaim,	“Become	stones	or	iron.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāo	ke	pathar	yā	lohā	ho	jāo

arabicText: أَوْ خَلْقًۭا مِّمَّا يَكْبُرُ فِى صُدُورِكُمْ ۚ فَسَيَقُولُونَ مَن يُعِيدُنَا ۖ قُلِ ٱلَّذِى فَطَرَكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۢ ۚ فَسَيُنْغِضُونَ إِلَيْكَ رُءُوسَهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هُوَ ۖ قُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ قَرِيبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Yā	 aur	 koi	 makhlooq	 jo	 tumhāre	 khayāl	
meiñ	badi	ho	to	ab	kaheñ	ge	hameiñ	koun	
phir	paida	karega	tum	farmāo	wohi	jis	ne	
tumheñ	 pehli	 bār	 paida	 kiya	 tha	 to	 ab	
tumhāri	 ṭaraf	 maskhargi	 se	 sar	 hila	 kar	
kaheñ	ge	yeh	kab	hai	 tum	 farmāo	shāyad	
nazdik	hi	ho
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	woh	tumheñ	bulāye	gā		to	tum	us	ki	
hamd	karte	chale	āaoge	aur	samjho	ge	ke	
na	rahe the	magar	thoda.

arabicText: يَوْمَ يَدْعُوكُمْ فَتَسْتَجِيبُونَ بِحَمْدِهِۦ وَتَظُنُّونَ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“The	 day	 when	 He	 will	 call	 you	 and	 you	
will	come	praising	Him,	thinking	you	have	
stayed only	a	little.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mere	bandoñ	se	farmāo	woh	bāt	kaheñ	
jo	 sab	 se	 achhi	 ho	 be	 shak	 shaiṭān	 un	 ke	
āpas	 meiñ	 fasād	 dāl	 deta	 hai	 be	 shak	
shaiṭān	ādmi	ka	khulā	dushman	hai

arabicText: وَقُل لِّعِبَادِى يَقُولُوا۟ ٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ يَنزَغُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ كَانَ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ عَدُوًّۭا مُّبِينًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	tell	My	bondmen	to	speak	that	which	
is	 the	 best;	 undoubtedly	 Satan	 sows	
discord	 among	 them;	 indeed	 Satan	 is	
man’s	open	enemy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāra	Rab	tumheñ	khoob	jānta	hai	woh	
chāhe	to	tum	par	raham	kare	yā	chāhe	to	
tumheñ	‘azāb	kare	aur	ham	ne	tum	ko	un	
par	kadoda	(zimmedār)	bana	kar	na	bheja.

arabicText: رَّبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ ۖ إِن يَشَأْ يَرْحَمْكُمْ أَوْ إِن يَشَأْ يُعَذِّبْكُمْ ۚ وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَكِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Your	Lord	knows	you	well;	if	He	wills	He	
may	have	mercy	upon	you,	or	if	He	wills,	
He	may	punish	you;	and	We have	not	sent	
you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	
and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 as	 a	 guardian	
over	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tumhāra	 Rab	 khoob	 jānta	 hai	 jo	 koi	
āasmānoñ	 aur	 zameen	 mein	 haiñ	 aur	 be	
shak	 ham	 ne	Nabiyoñ	meiñ	 ek	 ko	 ek	 par	
badhāi	 di	 aur	 Dāwood ko	 Zaboor ‘ata	
farmāyi

arabicText: وَرَبُّكَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَلَقَدْ فَضَّلْنَا بَعْضَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ زَبُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 your	 Lord	 knows	well	 all	 those	who	
are	 in	 the	 heavens	 and	 the	 earth;	 and	
indeed	 among	 the	 Prophets	 We	 gave	
excellence	 to	some	above	others,	and	We	
gave	the	Zaboor	to	Dawud.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tumhāra	 Rab	 khoob	 jānta	 hai	 jo	 koi	
āasmānoñ	 aur	 zameen	 mein	 haiñ	 aur	 be	
shak	 ham	 ne	Nabiyoñ	meiñ	 ek	 ko	 ek	 par	
badhāi	 di	 aur	 Dāwood ko	 Zaboor ‘ata	
farmāyi

arabicText: قُلِ ٱدْعُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ فَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ كَشْفَ ٱلضُّرِّ عَنكُمْ وَلَا تَحْوِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Call	upon	those	whom	you	assume	besides	Allah - so	they	do	not	have	any	power	to	
relieve	the	misfortune	from	you	nor	to	avert	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	maqbool	bandeñ	jinheñ	yeh	kāfir	poojte	haiñ	woh	āap	hi	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	waseela	dhuñdhte	
haiñ	ke	un	meiñ	kaun	ziyada	muqarrab	hai	us	ki	raḥmat	ki	ummid	rakhte	aur	us	ke	‘aƶāb	se	darte	
haiñ	be	shak	tumhāre	Rab	ka	‘aƶāb	dar	ki	chiz	hai

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ يَبْتَغُونَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمُ ٱلْوَسِيلَةَ أَيُّهُمْ أَقْرَبُ وَيَرْجُونَ رَحْمَتَهُۥ وَيَخَافُونَ عَذَابَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ كَانَ مَحْذُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	 devoted	 bondmen	 whom	 these	 disbelievers	 worship,	 themselves	 seek	 the	 means	 of	
proximity	 from	their	Lord,	that	who	among	them	is	the	closest	(to	his	Lord),	and	hope	 for	His	
mercy	and	fear	His	punishment;	indeed	the	punishment	of	your	Lord	is	to	be	feared.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	koi	basti	nahiñ	magar	yeh	ke	ham	use	roze	qayāmat	se	pehle	nist	(halāk)	kar	deñ	ge	yā	use	
sakht	‘aƶāb	deñ	ge	yeh	kitāb	meiñ	likhā	huwa	hai.

arabicText: وَإِن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا نَحْنُ مُهْلِكُوهَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ أَوْ مُعَذِّبُوهَا عَذَابًۭا شَدِيدًۭا ۚ كَانَ ذَٰلِكَ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مَسْطُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 there	is	no	 such	dwelling	but	which	We	 shall	destroy	before	 the	Day	 of	Resurrection,	 or	
punish	it	severely;	this	is	written	in	the	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	aisi	nishāniyāñ	bhej	ne	se	yooñ	hi	
bāz	 rahe	 ki unheñ	 agloñ	 ne	 jhutlāya	 aur	
ham	 ne	 ṣamood	 ko	 nāqā diya	 (ooñtni	 di)	
āankheñ	 kholne	 ko	 to	 unhoñ	 ne	 us	 par	
ẓulm	 kiya	 aur	 ham	 aisi	 nishāniyāñ	 nahiñ	
bhejte	magar	darāne	ko.

arabicText: وَمَا مَنَعَنَآ أَن نُّرْسِلَ بِٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ إِلَّآ أَن كَذَّبَ بِهَا ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ ۚ وَءَاتَيْنَا ثَمُودَ ٱلنَّاقَةَ مُبْصِرَةًۭ فَظَلَمُوا۟ بِهَا ۚ وَمَا نُرْسِلُ بِٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ إِلَّا تَخْوِيفًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 remained	 constrained	 from	
sending	 such	 signs,	 because	 the	 former	
people	 denied	 them;	 and	 We	 gave	 the	
Thamud	the	she-camel	for	enlighten-ment,	
so	 they	 oppressed	it;	and	We	do	not	send	
such	signs	except	to	warn.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Ham	ne	tum	se	farmāya	ke	sab	log	
tumhāre	Rab	ke	qābu	meiñ	haiñ	aur	ham	
ne	 na	 kiya	 woh	 dikhāwa	 jo	 tumheñ	
dikhāya	 tha	 magar	 logoñ	 ki	 āazmāish	 ko	
aur	woh	ped	jis	par	qurān	meiñ	l'anat	hai	
aur	ham	unheñ	darāte	haiñ	to	unheñ	nahi	
badhti	magar	badi	sarkashi

arabicText: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لَكَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ أَحَاطَ بِٱلنَّاسِ ۚ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا ٱلرُّءْيَا ٱلَّتِىٓ أَرَيْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا فِتْنَةًۭ لِّلنَّاسِ وَٱلشَّجَرَةَ ٱلْمَلْعُونَةَ فِى ٱلْقُرْءَانِ ۚ وَنُخَوِّفُهُمْ فَمَا يَزِيدُهُمْ إِلَّا طُغْيَـٰنًۭا كَبِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	We	proclaimed	to	you,	“Indeed
all	mankind	is	within	 the	 control	 of	 your	
Lord”;	and	We	did	not	create	the	spectacle	
*	 which	 We	 showed	 you	 except	 to	 try	
mankind,	and	the	Tree	**	which	is	cursed	
in	 the	 Qur’an;	 and	 We	 warn	 them	 - so	
nothing	 increases	 for	 them	 except	
extreme	 rebellion.	 (* The Ascent of the 
Holy Prophet to the heavens and 
beyond, which the disbelievers denied as 
just a dream. ** The Zakkum tree which 
will grow in hell and be the food for its 
inhabitants.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Ham	ne	tum	se	farmāya	ke	sab	log	
tumhāre	Rab	ke	qābu	meiñ	haiñ	aur	ham	
ne	 na	 kiya	 woh	 dikhāwa	 jo	 tumheñ	
dikhāya	 tha	 magar	 logoñ	 ki	 āazmāish	 ko	
aur	woh	ped	jis	par	qurān	meiñ	l'anat	hai	
aur	ham	unheñ	darāte	haiñ	to	unheñ	nahi	
badhti	magar	badi	sarkashi

arabicText: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ قَالَ ءَأَسْجُدُ لِمَنْ خَلَقْتَ طِينًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 recall	 when	 We	 ordered	 the	 angels	
that,	“Prostrate	before	Adam”	- so	they	all	
prostrated	 except	 Iblis;	 he	 said,	 “Shall	 I	
prostrate	 before	 one	 whom	 You	 have	
created	from	clay?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yād	 karo	 jab	 Ham	 ne	 farishtoñ	 ko	
ḥukmdiya	 ke	 ādam	 ko	 sajdah	 karo	 to	 un	
sab	ne	sajdah	kiya	siwa	iblees	ke	bola	kya	
mein	 ise	 sajdah	 karuñ	 jise	 tune	 mitti	 se	
banāya

arabicText: قَالَ أَرَءَيْتَكَ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كَرَّمْتَ عَلَىَّ لَئِنْ أَخَّرْتَنِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ لَأَحْتَنِكَنَّ ذُرِّيَّتَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “Behold	 this	 *	 - the	 one	 whom	
You	have	honoured	above	me	- if	You	give	
me	 respite	 till	 the	 Day	 of	 Resurrection,	 I	
will	surely	crush	his descendants,	except	a	
few.”	(* Prophet Adam.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bola	dekh	tu	jo	yeh tune	mujh	se	mu'azzaz	
rakha	 agar	 tu	 ne	 mujhe	 qayāmat	 tak	
mohlat	 di	 to	 zaroor	 maiñ	 is	 ki	 awlād	 ko	
peesh	dāluñ	(barbād	kar	dāluñ)	ga.

arabicText: قَالَ ٱذْهَبْ فَمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ فَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ جَزَآؤُكُمْ جَزَآءًۭ مَّوْفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“Be	gone	- therefore	whoever	among	them	follows	you	- so	hell	is	the	recompense	for	
you	all,	a	sufficient	punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Magar	thoda	farmāya	door	ho	tu	un	me	jo	
teri	pairvi	karega	to	be	shak	tum	sab	ka	badla	jahannam		hai	bhar	poor	saza.

arabicText: وَٱسْتَفْزِزْ مَنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتَ مِنْهُم بِصَوْتِكَ وَأَجْلِبْ عَلَيْهِم بِخَيْلِكَ وَرَجِلِكَ وَشَارِكْهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَمْوَٰلِ وَٱلْأَوْلَـٰدِ وَعِدْهُمْ ۚ وَمَا يَعِدُهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ إِلَّا غُرُورًا
englishTranslationText:
“And	 mislead	 those	 whom	 you	 can	 among	 them	 with	 your	 voice,	 and	 raise	 an	 army	 against	
them	with	your	cavalry	and	infantry,	and	be	their	partner	in	wealth	and	children,	and	give	them	
promises”;	and	Satan	does	not	promise	them	except	with	deception.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	digā	de	(bahkā	de)	un	me	se	jis	par	qudrat	pāye	apni	āwaz	se	aur	un	par	lām bāndh	lā	(fauji	
lashkar	chardha)	apne	sawāroñ	aur	apne	piyādoñ	ka	aur	un	ka	sājhi	ho	māloñ	aur	bacho	meiñ	
aur	unheñ	w’ada		de	aur	shaiṭān	unheñ	w’ada	nahiñ	deta	magar	fareb	se

arabicText: إِنَّ عِبَادِى لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَـٰنٌۭ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ وَكِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	My	bondmen	*	- you	do	not	have	any	power	over	them”;	and	your	Lord	is	Sufficient	as	a	
Trustee.	(*	The	chosen	virtuous	bondmen)
romanUrduTranslationText: Be	shak	jo	mere	bande	haiñ un	par	tera	kuchh	qābu	nahiñ	aur	tera	Rab	kāfi	hai	kām	banāne	ko

arabicText: رَّبُّكُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُزْجِى لَكُمُ ٱلْفُلْكَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ لِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِكُمْ رَحِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Your	Lord	is	He	Who	sails	the	ship	upon	the	seas	for	you,	so	that	you	may	seek	His	munificence;	
indeed	He	is	Most	Merciful	upon	you.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāra	Rab	woh	hai	ke	tumhāre	liye	daryā	meiñ	kashti	rawañ	karta	hai	ke	tum	us	ka	fazl	talāsh	
karo	be	shak	woh	tum	par	maherbān.

arabicText: وَإِذَا مَسَّكُمُ ٱلضُّرُّ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ ضَلَّ مَن تَدْعُونَ إِلَّآ إِيَّاهُ ۖ فَلَمَّا نَجَّىٰكُمْ إِلَى ٱلْبَرِّ أَعْرَضْتُمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ كَفُورًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 calamity	 strikes	 you	 upon	 the	
sea,	all	those	whom	you	worship	are	lost,	
except	 Him;	 then	 when	 He	 rescues	 you	
towards	land,	 you	 turn	away;	and	man	is	
extremely	ungrateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 tumheñ	 dariya	 meiñ	 musibat	
pahuñchti	hai	 to	us	ke	siwa	jinheñ	poojte	
ho	 sab	 gum	 ho	 jāte	 haiñ	 phir	 jab	 woh	
tumheñ	khushki	ki	ṭaraf	najāt	deta	hai	 to	
muñh	 pher	 lete	 ho	 aur	 ādmi	 bada	 nā		
shukra	hai

arabicText: أَفَأَمِنتُمْ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمْ جَانِبَ ٱلْبَرِّ أَوْ يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًۭا ثُمَّ لَا تَجِدُوا۟ لَكُمْ وَكِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
Are	 you	 unafraid	 that	 He	 may	 bury	 an	
edge	 of	 the	 same	land	along	with	 you,	 or	
send	 a	 shower	 of	 stones	 upon	 you,	 and	
you	find	no	supporter	for	yourselves?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	tum	isse	nidar	huwe	ke	woh	khushki	
hi	ka	koi	kināra	 tumhāre	sāth	dhansa	de!	
Yā	 tum	 par	 pathrāo	 bheje	 phir	 apna	 koi	
himāyati	na	pāo

arabicText: أَمْ أَمِنتُمْ أَن يُعِيدَكُمْ فِيهِ تَارَةً أُخْرَىٰ فَيُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ قَاصِفًۭا مِّنَ ٱلرِّيحِ فَيُغْرِقَكُم بِمَا كَفَرْتُمْ ۙ ثُمَّ لَا تَجِدُوا۟ لَكُمْ عَلَيْنَا بِهِۦ تَبِيعًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Or	 are	 you	 unafraid	 that	 He	 may	 again	
take	 you	 back	 to	 the	 sea,	 then	 send	
against	you	a	ship-breaking	gust	of	wind,	
therefore	 drowning	 you	 because	 of	 your	
disbelief	 - then	 you	 may	 not	 find	 for	
yourself	anyone	to	come	after	Us	for	this?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yā	is	se	nidar	(be	khouf)	huwe	ke	tumheñ	
do	bārāh	dariya	meiñ	le	jāye	phir	tum	par	
jahāz	todhne	wāli	āañdhi	bheje	to	tum	ko	
tumhāre	kufr	ke	sabab	dubo	de	phir	apne	
liye	koi	aisa	nā	pāo	ke	is	par	hamara	pichha	
kare.

arabicText: ۞ وَلَقَدْ كَرَّمْنَا بَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ وَحَمَلْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ وَرَزَقْنَـٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ وَفَضَّلْنَـٰهُمْ عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍۢ مِّمَّنْ خَلَقْنَا تَفْضِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 We	 have	 honoured	 the	
Descendants	 of	 Adam	 and	 transported	
them	 over	 land	 and	 sea,	 and	 gave	 them	
good	 things	 as	 sustenance,	 and	 made	
them	better	than	most	of	Our	creation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be	 shak	 ham	 ne	 Awlād-e-Ādam	 ko	
Izzat	 di	 aur	 un	 ko	 khushki	 aur	 tari	 meiñ	
sawār	kiya	aur	un	ko	suthri	chizeñ	rozi	di	
aur	 un	 ko	 apni	 bahut	 makhlooq	 se	 afzal	
kiya.

arabicText: يَوْمَ نَدْعُوا۟ كُلَّ أُنَاسٍۭ بِإِمَـٰمِهِمْ ۖ فَمَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَقْرَءُونَ كِتَـٰبَهُمْ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ فَتِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
On	the	day	when	We	shall	summon	every	
group	along	with	its	leader;	so	whoever	is	
given	his	register	in	his	right	hand	- these	
will	 read	 their	 accounts	 and	 their	 rights	
will	 not	 be	 suppressed	 even	 a	 thread.	(*	
They	will	be	given	the	full	reward.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Jis	din	ham	har	jamā'at	ko	us	ke	imām	ke	
sāth	 bulāyeñ	 ge	 to	 jo	 apnā	 nāma	 dāhine		
hāth	meiñ	diya	gaya	yeh	log	apna	nāma	padheñ	ge	aur	tāge	bhar	un	ka	haq	na	dabāya	jāyega

arabicText: وَمَن كَانَ فِى هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أَعْمَىٰ فَهُوَ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَعْمَىٰ وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	is	blind	* in	this	life	will	be	blind	
in	the	Hereafter,	and	even	more	astray.	(*	To	the	truth	- disbelieving.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jo	is	zindagi	meiñ	andha	ho	woh	ākhirat	meiñ	andha	hai	aur	aur	bhi	ziyada	gumrāh

arabicText: وَإِن كَادُوا۟ لَيَفْتِنُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ لِتَفْتَرِىَ عَلَيْنَا غَيْرَهُۥ ۖ وَإِذًۭا لَّٱتَّخَذُوكَ خَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	it	was	close	that	they	were	about	to	mislead	you	somewhat	from	the	divine	revelation	We	
sent	 to	 you,	 for	 you	 to	 attribute	 something	 else	 *	 to	 Us;	 and	 if	 it	 were	 **,	 they	 would	 have	
accepted	you	as	a	friend.	(*	Other	than	the	divine	revelation.	**	Which	is	impossible.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	to	qareeb	tha	ke	tumheñ	kuchh	lagzish	dete	Hamāri	waḥi	se	jo	ham	ne	tum	ko	bheji	ke	
tum	hamari	ṭaraf	kuchh	aur	nisbat	kardo	aur	aisa	hota	to	woh	tum	ko	apna	gahra	dost	bana	lete.

arabicText: وَلَوْلَآ أَن ثَبَّتْنَـٰكَ لَقَدْ كِدتَّ تَرْكَنُ إِلَيْهِمْ شَيْـًۭٔا قَلِيلًا
englishTranslationText: And	had	We	not	kept	you	steadfast,	possibly	you	might	have	inclined	to	them	just	a	little.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	Ham	tumheñ	ṣābit	qadam	na	rakhte	to	qareeb	tha	ke	tum	un	ki	ṭaraf	kuchh	thoda	sa	
jhukte

arabicText: إِذًۭا لَّأَذَقْنَـٰكَ ضِعْفَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ وَضِعْفَ ٱلْمَمَاتِ ثُمَّ لَا تَجِدُ لَكَ عَلَيْنَا نَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	if	it	were	 *,	We	would	 then	 have	made	 you	 taste	a	 double	life	and	a	 double	 death	- you	
would	then	not	find	any	supporter	against	Us.	(*	Which	is	impossible.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aisa	hota	to	Ham	tum	ko	dooni	umar	aur	do	chand	mout	ka	maza'h	dete	phir	tum	hamare	
muqābil	apna	koi	madadgār	na	pāte

arabicText: وَإِن كَادُوا۟ لَيَسْتَفِزُّونَكَ مِنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ لِيُخْرِجُوكَ مِنْهَا ۖ وَإِذًۭا لَّا يَلْبَثُونَ خِلَـٰفَكَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	it	was	close	that	they	frighten	
you	in	the	land	for	them	to	oust	you	from	
it	 - and	 if	 it	 were,	 they	 would	 not	 have	
stayed	after	you,	but	a	little.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	qareeb	tha	ke	woh	tumheñ	is	
zameen	se	digā	deñ	(hatā	deñ)	ke	tumheñ	
is	 se	 bāhar	 kar	 deñ	 aur	 aisa	 hota	 to	woh	
tumhāre	pichhe	na	thaherte	magar	thoda

arabicText: سُنَّةَ مَن قَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِن رُّسُلِنَا ۖ وَلَا تَجِدُ لِسُنَّتِنَا تَحْوِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
The	tradition	of	the	Noble	Messengers	We	
sent	before	you	- and	you	will	not	find	Our	
rules	changing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Dastoor	 un	 ka	 jo	 ham	 ne	 tum	 se	 pehle	
Rasool bheje	 aur	 tum	 hamara	 qanoon	
badalta	na	pāoge
